title: Design and Performance Assessment of Low Carbon Buildings | Singapore Institute of Technology

Design and Performance Assessment of Low Carbon Buildings
Design and Performance Assessment of Low Carbon Buildings
Offers a comprehensive overview of low carbon buildings, emphasising engineering aspects of design and operation for sustainable development goals.

This course provides a comprehensive overview of low-carbon buildings, focusing on their significance for sustainable development goals with an emphasis on the engineering aspects of building design and operation.

It covers the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in building design, construction, and operation for low carbon buildings. The course also explores the role of building materials, construction techniques, and engineering systems in achieving low-carbon buildings. Various strategies, technologies, and approaches for reducing greenhouse gas emissions in areas such as HVAC, electrical services, water resources, and indoor air quality will be discussed. The challenges, opportunities, and engineering solutions for low-carbon buildings in different contexts will be examined, along with an exploration of the policies, regulations, and incentives associated with low carbon buildings. The new SIT Punggol campus, home to two super low energy buildings, will be used as a living lab to demonstrate the best-in-class energy-efficient buildings.
Professionals in engineering, architecture, construction, building management, and environmental sustainability, with a specific focus on the design and operation of low carbon buildings
IPolicymakers, urban planners, developers, and individuals interested in gaining an in-depth understanding of the design, construction, and engineering aspects of low carbon buildings
Prior knowledge of sustainable building concepts is recommended but not required
Basic understanding of the design, construction, and operation principles of building energy systems
Understand the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in building design, construction, and operation for energy-efficient and sustainable buildings
Evaluate energy efficiency strategies, sustainable building design, green materials, renewable energy systems, indoor environmental quality, and building automation systems
Apply principles and methods to analyse, design, and operate energy-efficient and sustainable buildings
Utilise tools to assess the environmental impact and life cycle analysis of building materials and products
Conduct a building energy and sustainability audit and identify opportunities for improvement
Upon completion of the course, learners will be able to:
Gain a comprehensive understanding of net-zero building principles, including design and construction strategies
Learn about building automation, energy management systems, and indoor environmental quality control
Explore sustainable water management, material usage, and advanced energy-efficient technologies
Understand performance metrics, building audits, and analysis to optimise efficiency
Acquire knowledge and skills to evaluate building performance
Learn the competency to identify areas for improvement and implement strategies that maximise building sustainability and occupant comfort and health in a net-zero energy and carbon context.

The course will be delivered through a combination of lectures, interactive discussions, hands-on exercises, and case studies. The delivery method will emphasise active participation and group activities to facilitate learning. Learners will also be provided with course materials and additional resources such as recommended readings, online resources, and case studies to enhance their understanding and skills.
Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Lock is a Professor (Engineering) at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) and the Head of its Energy Efficiency Technology Centre. He plays an active role in energy efficiency and sustainability, being the Chairman of Accreditation Committee for Energy Service Companies (ESCOs) and the Co-Chair of Steering Committee of Singapore Certified Energy Managers (SCEM) Scheme. He is an

awarded by the Uptime Institute. He is a specialist consulting engineer in the areas of mission-critical electrical design, power quality, EMC, and safety. He conducted many power failure investigations of data centres.

Professor Lock has a unique blend of practicing and academic experience acquired through a career which is equally split between the industry and the academia. He received both his B.Sc. (1975) and Ph.D. (1979) degrees in Electrical Engineering from the University of Strathclyde, UK. He was a faculty at the Department of Electrical Engineering, National University of Singapore for 17 years when he left to set up his consulting practice in 1997. He returned to the academia as a professor at SIT in 2016 after 20 years in the industry.

He is a registered Professional Engineer (Electrical) and served as a Board Member of the Professional Engineers Board, Singapore for 14 years. He is a Fellow of Academy of Engineering Singapore and an Honorary Fellow of the ASEAN Federation of Engineering Organizations.

He is the co-Laureate of the 2021 WFEO Medal for Excellence in Engineering Education awarded by the World Federation of Engineering Organisations. He received the Public Service Medal (2015) and the Public Service Star (2020).
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Steve Kardinal Jusuf is an Associate Professor in the Engineering Cluster, SIT. He is a Chartered Engineer (UK) and Member of the Chartered Institution of Building Services Engineers (MCIBSE); a member of The Institution of Engineers Singapore (IES); and a certified LEED Green Associate (a US-based green building rating system).

He serves as the Co-Chair of the Sustainability Education Committee (SEC) at the Singapore Institute of Technology. His expertise and research interests are in green building technology and sustainability; Building Information Modelling (BIM) and building energy simulation; and neighbourhood microclimate modelling.

He is a member of several national-level working groups, setting up industry standards and guidelines. He is also a member of the Passive Displacement Coil Technical Working Group, developing TR 102:2022 technical reference, a code of practice for passive displacement cooling (PDC) systems for air-conditioning applications. He was a member of the Resource Efficiency Working Group of Clean and Green Standard for Urban Farms (Agriculture), developing SS 661:2020, a specification for clean and green urban farms — Agriculture, led by SFA.
Assistant Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Zhao Ming-Shan obtained his PhD in Civil Engineering from NTU Singapore in 2015. His research is related to high performance structural steel, steel-concrete composite construction and low embodied carbon construction materials. His teaching interests include mechanics of materials, finite element method for structural analysis, and design of steel and steel-concrete composite structures. He has been awarded a total research grant of SGD$1.9M as a Co-PI. He has published 17 international refereed journal papers and 25 international conference papers.
Assoc Professor/Deputy Cluster Dir, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assoc Professor/Deputy Cluster Dir, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Chew Beng specialises in material science and defects study. He teaches in the SIE(BS), UoG programme on Advanced Materials Technology and EPE, SIT-Newcastle Electrical Power Engineering Program on Signals and Comms as well as Electrical Machines. He holds a Bachelor of Electrical Engineering (ECE) and PhD (ECE) from the National University of Singapore. He has worked as a scientist in IMRE, A*STAR before his current appointment with SIT.
Vice President, Business and Operation of G-Energy Global Pte Ltd
Vice President, Business and Operation of G-Energy Global Pte Ltd

An accredited Key Qualified Person, Singapore Certified Energy Manager (Professional Level) and Certified Green Mark Professional to assist companies to apply for NEA grant on energy audit program and BCA Green Mark Incentive Scheme. Joseph also has been lecturing Specialist Diploma in Energy Efficiency and Management Course in Singapore Polytechnic and Sustainable Energy Association of Singapore since 2003 till now. He is also a registered trainer to conduct Singapore Certified Energy Manager, Diploma in Facilities & Energy Management and Green Mark Manager/Professional Course and Energy Audit and Management at the University of SIM. Lately he represented Singapore to complete Asian Energy Management Scheme Country Expert program and in the process of developing training program to assist organizations in improving their internal energy management practices. Currently, he is also appointed as Green Mark Energy Modelling External Assessor and Examiner for Green Mark Manager/Professional Course.

As an Energy Consultant practicing actively since 2002, Joseph has led and facilitated energy conservation projects in multiple scopes with numerous companies. In 2005, Green Mark Singapore was launched as an initiative to promote sustainability in the built environment and raise environmental awareness among developers, designers and builders. Coupled with his strong desire and passion to see greater green dynamics and synergy within our building environment in Singapore, G-Energy Global was founded.

Kevin Sturrock, a globally acclaimed expert in architectural illumination design, brings 37 years of experience blending natural daylight with electric light to enhance human perception, health, and well-being. His innovative, sustainable lighting solutions have earned numerous accolades, including the SIA Architectural Design Award for Rhizome House (2017), the London Design Awards Gold for Bonnevaux Meditation Retreat (2020), and the SIA Environmental Design Award for Zhongshan Park (2014).

As the founder of DP Lighting and co-founder of iLAB Sydney and Singapore, his career is firmly grounded in principles learnt from early experiences and collaborations. He has collaborated with lighting design pioneers like William M.C. Lam and Jonathan Speirs. He actively engages in all stages of design and implementation, ensuring efficient and successful project outcomes. He also shares his expertise gained as an adjunct lecturer at Temasek Polytechnic and as a visiting lecturer at prestigious institutions worldwide. Kevin’s lifelong passion for light continues to shape creative, impactful, and sustainable design solutions globally.
Principal Manager, Green Mark Department (Environmental Sustainability Group), Building and Construction Authority
Principal Manager, Green Mark Department (Environmental Sustainability Group), Building and Construction Authority

Er. Leow is a dedicated environmental sustainability professional who led the implementation of Environmental Sustainability Regulations under the Building Control Act for new and existing buildings, supporting the Singapore Green Building Masterplan. He has assessed over 100 Green Mark projects as lead assessor, evaluating sustainable building designs and practices. Er. Leow led the development of BCA Green Mark for Laboratories, contributed to the revision of Green Mark non-residential building criteria, and participated in the development of industry standards.

Er. Leow graduated from the National University of Singapore in 2008 with a Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering (2nd Upper Honours) and in 2018 as the medal winner for Master of Building Science (Building Performance and Sustainability). He received the SkillsFuture Award @ Public Service in 2019 for his commitment to lifelong learning and training others. Since 2009, Er. Leow has been a key lecturer on Green Mark subjects and environmental sustainability regulations for the Green Mark Manager course.
Founder & CEO, LJ Energy Pte Ltd
Founder & CEO, LJ Energy Pte Ltd

Dr. Lal Jayamaha is the author of two books on energy efficiency titled “Energy Efficient Building Systems” and “Energy Efficient Industrial Systems”, both published by McGraw-Hill, USA and the founder of LJ Energy which is one of the leading ESCOs (Energy Service Companies) with offices in Singapore, Malaysia, Sri Lanka and Vietnam.

He graduated from Queen Mary College, University of London with a First Class Honours degree in Mechanical Engineering in 1982. In 1990 he was awarded a Research Scholarship by the National University of Singapore to undertake research leading to a MEng degree. After completing his Master’s degree in 1993 he continued his research in heat transfer relating to building heat gain and building energy performance and was awarded a PhD. degree in 1997. After completing his PhD, he specialised in the area of energy management and has been the team leader for many major energy audits and energy retrofits carried out in the Asian region.

He is an EEO Assessor, SCEM (Certified Energy Manager), LEED AP (Accredited Professional), Professional Engineer (PE), Chartered Engineer (UK), GBI Facilitator, Green Mark AAP, BCA Registered Energy Auditor, and GreenRE Accredited Professional. He is also a member of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers, UK and the American Society for Heating, Refrigerating and Air-conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE).
Associate Vice President, Estates, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Vice President, Estates, Singapore Institute of Technology

Gerry oversees both campus development and facilities management in SIT. He led the development of SIT’s smart and sustainable campus in Punggol Town, beginning with master planning of the campus in 2014, right through construction and its completion in 2024. Prior to Punggol Campus, Gerry led in the development of SIT’s satellite campuses in each of the 5 Polytechnics in Singapore and refurbishment of a holding campus in Dover.

He has more than 35 years in consultancy, project management and facilities management. He has been involved in master planning and project management of large-scale developments and campuses such as the Batam Industrial Park, Changi Naval Base, the Nanyang Technological University Campus and the Institute of Mental Health. His experience in overseas projects includes developing chanceries and residences in Riyadh, New Delhi and Phnom Penh for the Singapore government.

He holds a Bachelor of Architecture from the University of Singapore and is a Registered Architect with the Board of Architects. He currently sits on the tenders board of the National Kidney Foundation, a non-profit health organisation.
Chief Engineer and Net Zero Carbon Director, Cushman & Wakefield
Chief Engineer and Net Zero Carbon Director, Cushman & Wakefield
Chee Kit is an Asset Management Practitioner based in Singapore who heads up Cushman & Wakefield’s Sustainability and Net Zero Carbon Assets Technical Consultancy for Asia Pacific.

His team focus is on sustainability, enhancing asset value by minimising operating costs and improving efficiencies to protect the value of each investment. In addition, Chee Kit’s experience includes sustainable facility and property management, leveraging Artificial Intelligence for Building Services, Green building design and construction, energy efficiency, and greenhouse gas reduction, and brings his nuanced understanding of working across diverse regulatory environments, mixed asset classes, and balancing carbon reduction goals with other business objectives.
Topic: Introduction, green materials, sustainable design and construction
Introduction to energy efficient and sustainable buildings
Regulatory framework for the environmental sustainability of buildings
Singapore code of environmental sustainability for new and existing buildings
Singapore Green Mark standards and rating systems for new and existing buildings

Integrated building design strategies (include collaborative design processes that involve all stakeholders from architects, engineers, and clients to contractors to create integrated sustainable building solutions)

Sustainable landscaping and site design (include stormwater management techniques, such as green roofs, rain gardens, and permeable pavements, to minimize environmental impact and enhancing building performance)
Energy-efficient building envelope design (explore advanced topics like phase change materials for thermal regulation and smart glass technology)
Building information modeling (BIM) in sustainable design (demonstrate BIM-integrated energy modelling tools)
Net-zero energy and carbon principles (clarify the distinction between net-zero operational energy, net-zero embodied carbon, net positive energy, with examples of each)
Optimising building design, orientation, shading, and ventilation
Building whole life carbon and cost analysis
Sustainable building materials, their properties and selection
Life cycle assessment (LCA) and environmental product declaration (EPD) of building materials and products
Day 1 case study 2: Sustainable construction method and materials
Topic: HVAC systems and indoor environmental quality
HVAC systems and their role in carbon reduction
Smart sensors and IoT-based HVAC controls
Energy management systems and HVAC performance monitoring
Heat pumps and thermal energy storage systems
Indoor air quality (IAQ) and its effects on human health and productivity
Ventilation and air conditioning for IAQ
Lighting and acoustics for occupant comfort
Building automation systems for IEQ control
2-hour sharing sessions by guest speakers – presentations and panel discussion, including retrofitting existing buildings and leveraging renewable energy credits, operation and maintenance
Topic: Energy Efficient Lighting and Sustainable Building Services
Light – Visual Planning & Design for Low Carbon & WELL Buildings
Lighting in low carbon and WELL buildings
Good-practice lighting design & lighting control principles using daylight and electric light
Green Mark and WELL standard lighting benchmarks
Latest technological advances in LED efficacies and associated LOR’s (light-output-ratios) and glare control
Example case studies and lighting demonstrations
Energy efficient electrical installations and building electricity distribution
Ensuring safe, efficient, and reliable electrical services
Building energy performance monitoring, management and optimisation
Examples of successful BEMS implementation in low-carbon buildings
Topic: Renewable Energy Systems, Smart Technologies, and Site Visit to Net-Zero Building
Renewable energy systems and emerging technologies
Renewable energy integration and energy storage for net-zero buildings
Emerging technologies for super low energy buildings
Smart technologies and internet of things
Learning from site visits to SIT sustainable Punggol Campus buildings and facilities
The new SIT Punggol campus, home to two Super Low Energy buildings, will be used as a living lab to demonstrate the best-in-class energy-efficient buildings
Sharing of sustainable development of campus development project
Topic: Building energy/sustainability audit, and class assessment
Assessment methods to quantify energy efficiency and sustainability of buildings
Preparation of energy/sustainability audit report, complete with performance evaluation and recommendations
Building operation and maintenance best practices for sustainable buildings
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
Learners will be assessed based on their engagement, participation, and successful completion of an energy/sustainability evaluation report.
The full fee for this course is S$5,450.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
